snippet: Consumer prices rose at an annual rate of 0.7 percent, but continuing fears of deflation may keep pressure on the European Central Bank to act.
abstract: European Union statistics agency Eurostate reports annual rate of inflation in the euro zone rose to 0.7 percent in April 2014, from 0.5 percent in March; rate remains well below European Central Bank's official target of slightly less than 2 percent.
lead_paragraph: Consumer prices rose at an annual rate of 0.7 percent, but continuing fears of deflation may keep pressure on the European Central Bank to act.

headline.main: Euro Zone Inflation Edges Up in April
headline.print_headline: Euro Zone Inflation Rises, but Remains Below Target
